title: News regarding BlockChain Verify
story_body:
BlackRock Inc. (NYSE: BLK) announced today that Sarah Chen has been appointed as Senior Vice President of Digital Asset Strategy, effective January 15. Chen, who previously served as Managing Director of Innovation at the firm, will report directly to Chief Operating Officer Rob Goldstein. The role involves overseeing BlackRock's blockchain initiatives and digital asset product development.

"Sarah brings deep expertise in both traditional finance and emerging technologies," said Goldstein in a statement. "Her leadership will be instrumental as we continue to explore blockchain applications across our platform."

Chen joined BlackRock in 2019 and has led several technology transformation projects within the firm's Aladdin platform division. She holds an MBA from Wharton and previously worked at JPMorgan Chase in their blockchain development team.

The appointment comes as BlackRock prepares to participate in the Digital Assets Summit 2024 in Miami next month. The firm will host a panel discussion on institutional adoption of blockchain technology, featuring Chen alongside other senior executives from the technology and operations teams.

Additionally, BlackRock unveiled its "Invest in Tomorrow" marketing campaign this week, focusing on the firm's technology-forward approach to asset management. The campaign includes digital advertisements across financial publications and social media platforms, highlighting the company's use of data analytics and emerging technologies in portfolio management.

In a separate development, BlackRock announced the expansion of its Green Technology Fund to include investments in blockchain companies focused on carbon credit verification and supply chain transparency. The initiative, part of the firm's broader environmental, social, and governance (ESG) strategy, will allocate up to $50 million to early-stage companies developing blockchain solutions for environmental monitoring.

"We see significant potential in blockchain technology to enhance transparency in ESG reporting," said Jennifer Wu, Head of Sustainable Investing at BlackRock. "This modest allocation allows us to support innovative solutions while maintaining our disciplined investment approach."

The Green Technology Fund expansion will begin accepting applications from qualifying companies in the first quarter of 2024. BlackRock manages approximately $9.4 trillion in assets globally and has been gradually increasing its exposure to digital asset technologies over the past several years.
